intro: Blepharispermum obovatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a low-growing, succulent perennial that thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features small, pale yellow or white flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom during the rainy season. Its fleshy, obovate leaves are adapted to store water, making it well-suited for drought conditions. The species is often found in sandy or gravelly soils, contributing to its ecological role in stabilizing soils in its native habitat.
